post.content:
When I was one the way to work, I read an interesting article about job hunting on the subway. The paper says only 10 percent of the whole jobs are one the internet or on the news paper. Most of jobs are the hidden ones. So how can we find that hiddend jobs? The answer is very simple which is "use your network". First, make a list of your network including everyone you've had an acquaintance so far, such as friends of friends, bank manager, hair-dresser ,whoever it is. Second, call them and ask them to do you a favor for ten minutes, Don't ask them if they could provide you with information of job openings now, but you should start with your situation in job hunting and tell them what kind of skills you have and what sort of job do you want, and check with them if they know somebody who can help you out about it. and then make sure to call them again and check if they are looking into the possiblity of finding someone who can be of a big help to you.
Maybe it is nothing new to us. If you alreay knew about it, why don't you put it in practice right away?
-end-
post.title: Article from newspaper about Job hunting.
